name: Homemade Chex® Party Mix
author: Wick of Twizt
summary: This homemade snack mix recipe my mom has had since it originated in the 1940s. This was always a holiday favorite at our house. So much better than the newer versions with a richer flavor with the extra butter. This is a very hard-to-find recipe so I thought I'd share. Great to put in tins and give away. I always quadruple the recipe and store extra in freezer. Store in an airtight container or large zip-top bags.
ingredients: 4 cups crispy rice cereal squares (such as Rice Chex™)
4 cups crispy wheat cereal squares (such as Wheat Chex™)
4 cups crispy corn cereal squares (such as Corn Chex™)
4 cups toasted oat cereal (such as Cheerios™)
directions: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C)
Melt butter, Worcestershire, garlic salt, and celery salt over low heat in a medium saucepan until butter has dissolved, 3 to 5 minutes
Combine rice cereal, wheat cereal, corn cereal, oat cereal, mixed nuts, and pretzel sticks in a large mixing bowl
Pour butter mixture over and gently stir to coat all of the pieces
Transfer mixture to a large roasting pan
Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 2 hours, stirring gently every 15 minutes
Remove from the oven and let cool completely, about 1 hour
